resources.string: 20 different ratio calculators covering 5 key financial ratios. Select a ratio from the below and use the calculator:
Profitability ratio is a financial metrics that is used to measure profit generation and management.
Liquidity ratio is a financial metrics that is used to determine a companies ability to pay short and long-term liabilities (Loans/Bills payable) without raising external capital.
Efficiency ratio is a financial metrics that is used to measure, how well a company can use its assets and liabilities to generate income. It is also called as activity ratios.
Financial Leverage ratio is a financial metrics that is used to measure, how effectively a company can manage its debt to generate income.
Market value ratio is a financial metrics that is used to evaluate the value of a publicly traded company based on its reported financial and current market price.

Profitability ratio is a measure that helps, an investor or lender to understand the net amount of returns made out of a firms sales, assets and equity. Some of the most commonly used profitability ratios - Net Profit Margin, Gross Profit Margin, Return on Equity (ROE), Return on Capital Employed (ROCE), Return on Assets (ROA) and Return on Investment (ROI).
Key in the Net Sales and Net Income Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the Net Sales and Cost of Goods (COGS) Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the Net Income and Total Shareholdersâ€™ Equity Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Return on Capital Employed Ratio Calculator
Key in the Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT), Total Assets and Current Liabilities Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the Net Income and Total Assets Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the Net Income, Shareholders Equity and Long-term Liabilities Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:

Liquidity ratio is a measure that helps, an investor or lender to understand a firms ability to pay its short-term and long-term liability. Some of the most commonly used liquidity ratios - Current Ratio, Quick Ratio, Cash Ratio and Net Working Capital Ratio.
Key in the Current Assets and Current Liabilities Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the Current Assets, Inventory and Current Liabilities Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the Cash Equivalents, Marketable Securities and Current Liabilities Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the Current Assets, Current Liabilities and Total Assets Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:

Efficiency ratio is a measure that helps, an investor or lender to understand a firms ability in utilizing its assets and liabilities to generate income. Some of the most commonly used Efficiency ratios - Assets turnover ratio, Accounts receivable turnover ratio and Inventory turnover ratio.
Key in the values of Net Sales, Total Assets at the beginning and ending of the year to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the values of Net Sales, Accounts Receivable at the beginning and ending of the year to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the Cost of Goods Sold (COGS), Inventory at the beginning and ending values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:

Financial leverage ratio is a measure that helps, an investor or lender to understand the capital structure of a firm. Some of the most commonly used financial leverage ratios - debt to equity (D/E) ratio, debt ratio, equity ratio and interest coverage ratio.
Key in the Total Liabilities and Total Equity Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the Total Liabilities and Total Assets Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the Total Equity and Total Assets Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the Earnings before interest and tax (EBIT) and Interest Expense Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:

Market prospect ratio is used to measure a firms performance from an investor perspective. Some of the most commonly used market prospect ratios - Earnings per share (EPS), Price to earnings (P/E) ratio and Dividend payout ratio.
Key in the Net Income, Preferred Dividends and Shares Outstanding Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the Net Income, Preferred Dividends, Shares Outstanding and Market Value Per Share to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
Key in the Total Dividends Paid and Net Income Values to the respective fields given below and then click Calculate:
